Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a solo home run
Shohei Ohtani drove a ball down the right-field line at about 1,000 mph
Will Smith blasted another weak pitch over the center-field fence
The Padres haven't scored in 15 innings dating to the second inning of Game 3
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers entered the game missing two key injured players - Freddie Freeman and Miguel Rojas
The Dodgers were forced to navigate with no starter and all bullpen
The Dodgers predicted they could hit Padres starter Dylan Cease on short rest
Michael Kopech unapologetically threw inside to a flattened Fernando Tatis Jr.
The Dodgers had the Padres right where they wanted them
The Dodgers showed they could be emotionally prepared to deal with their intense little brothers
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers are now in a position to win the series in Game 5
The series opener featured a monster first punch by the home-run-hitting Ohtani
The second game was filled with showboating Padres who taunted bottle-throwing fans
When Game 3 came to San Diego, the Dodgers initially didn't come with it, failing to show for most of a lackluster loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: Third base umpire Mark Ripperger made a call that stopped Ohtani from stealing a run
Ohtani screamed at Ripperger in a rare show of anger
The Dodgers are in a street fight with the Padres
The series is now set for a winner-take-all Game 5 at Dodger Stadium
The Dodgers have a 2-1 lead in the series with two games to go
